candidates.title: Update packages & Rust 2021
candidates.body: Update packages. Update docs. Remove nightly requirement. Update CI. Remove nix files. Add rust-toolchain.toml.

candidates.title: Update ipfs-embed and iced
candidates.body: Iced now supports copy in addition to paste, and ipfs-embed should have a better chance of go-ipfs interop.

candidates.title: Streaming Thumbnails
candidates.body:
Let's put this back. I learned a few valuable things when experimenting with Rayon, and I think the streaming approach will offer better scalability and flexibility.

![Screenshot from 2021-01-22 06-16-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285690/105495531-852c4000-5c79-11eb-833b-22bee668ee85.jpg)

candidates.title: 67 Thumbnails - Rayon
candidates.body:
I went back to Rayon because even though it's not streaming, it works about twice as fast and doesn't feel as janky. It's also a much simpler design. That said, I learned a lot of really good things from my experiments with Iced subscriptions and parallel stream processing, so I left the old code in thumbnails.rs, just unused.

Related: #67
Closes: #21

candidates.title: Nix build WIP
candidates.body:
Enables nix builds. In the future, nix build needs to be added to CI and a Cachix server.

This was initially started to explore building with a musl backend and a glow frontend.

Musl works now, but glow does not. See:

https://github.com/hecrj/iced/issues/674#issuecomment-761164182
https://github.com/hecrj/iced/pull/354#issuecomment-635560478

The cargo2nix issue for building to the musl target was fixed, however:
https://github.com/cargo2nix/cargo2nix/issues/149

There is code in the last few commits that reverts both the musl target back to linux-gnu, and glow back to wgpu. Musl works, but doesn't find the graphics adapter on my machine. Glow OpenGL support is needed, in that case.

candidates.title: tests: unit tests for image and text
candidates.body:
Hey @cryptoquick! This project looks really cool :)

This is a partial implementation of #65.


Signed-off-by: Chris Goller <goller@gmail.com>

candidates.title: Release improvements
candidates.body:
Compiles with:
```sh
cargo +nightly build --release && cargo strip
```

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285690/103579911-73375880-4e96-11eb-88d0-71f4708707ae.mp4

candidates.title: Separate StorageService and NetworkService initialization
candidates.body: Refactor StorageService and NetworkService initialization separately to more easily alter configuration from defaults, and have a reference that can be passed to other methods. These references are then passed to the ipfs_embed `Ipfs` initializer, rather than relying on defaults.

candidates.title: Update iced to latest git revision. Update crates.
candidates.body: Gonna merge this and hold off on work on the P2P VPN until later. libp2p is almost there, I think, we should spend our time elsewhere.

candidates.title: Image and text storing and loading
candidates.body:
Can now store text and images
Can now view text and images
Renamed Content page to View page
Added some fast-build config

candidates.title: Content handling cleanup & fixes
candidates.body:
Finally got this to work. I forgot to decode the data after being retrieved from IPFS before trying to pass that to the Iced image renderer.

This also includes some minor cleanup and improvements made while investigating other things.

I think I'm going to close the other PRs for now.

candidates.title: Merge Dashboard
candidates.body: This is how I would've merged dashboard originally. I will also compare this branch with the latest changes that have been pushed to the current dashboard branch.

candidates.title: Experimental ipfs-embed
candidates.body:
Closes #14 

Not yet ready. File doesn't compile, so it's not used, just here for when it might be ready sometime in the future. There are some nice features I look forward to using in the future, but for now, I think we're stuck with go-ipfs.

candidates.title: Drag and drop on publish page.
